plugin configure

Usage Synopsis
Call the interactive prompt to set plugin variables $ appbuilder plugin configure <Name or ID> [--debug] [--release]
Set one value for all applicable configurations $ appbuilder plugin configure <Name or ID> [--debug] [--release] --var.<Variable ID> <Variable Value>**
Set different values for all configurations $ appbuilder plugin configure <Name or ID> --var.debug.<Variable ID> <Variable Value> --var.release.<Variable ID> <Variable Value>]*>]***

** If the plugin has multiple variables, you can set --var for each variable.

*** This command is available only for Apache Cordova plugins. If the plugin has multiple variables, you can set --var for each variable.

Configures plugin variables for the selected plugin.If you have not set one or more of the plugin variables with --var, the AppBuilder CLI shows an interactive prompt to let you set their values.

Options

  • --var.<Variable ID> - Sets the value for the specified plugin variable in all configurations. If --debug or --release is specified, sets the variable for the respective configuration only, if the plugin is already enabled for this configuration.

  • --debug - Sets the plugin variable for the Debug build configuration only. The plugin must be enabled for the specified configuration.

  • --release - Sets the plugin variable for the Release build configuration only. The plugin must be enabled for the specified configuration.
  • --var.debug.<Variable ID> - Sets the value for the specified plugin variable for the Debug configuration only. The plugin must be enabled for the specified configuration.
  • --var.release.<Variable ID> - Sets the value for the specified plugin variable for the Release configuration only. The plugin must be enabled for the specified configuration.

Attributes

  • <Name or ID> is the name or ID of the plugin as listed by $ appbuilder plugin
  • <Variable ID> is the plugin variable as listed in the plugin.xml or package.json of the plugin.

Command Limitations

  • You cannot run this command on NativeScript projects.

Related Commands

Command Description
kendoui Lists the available Kendo UI Core or Kendo UI Professional packages that you can add to your project.
kendoui install Updates or adds Kendo UI Code or Kendo UI Professional to your project.
kendoui notes Shows release notes for the available Kendo UI Core and Kendo UI Professional packages.
plugin Lists all Apache Cordova plugins or custom npm or NativeScript modules that are currently enabled for your project.
plugin add Enables Apache Cordova plugins or custom npm or NativeScript modules for your project.
plugin remove Disables Apache Cordova plugins or custom npm or NativeScript modules from your project.
plugin find Searches by one or more keywords for Apache Cordova plugins or custom npm or NativeScript modules.
plugin fetch Imports the selected Apache Cordova plugins or custom npm or NativeScript modules into your project.
